page.title: 17Attitudes in S'key&C'thorpe.
page.content: {Local pride}in past; love of marshes and village. People friendly to strangers but protect privacy. Approve conservation that does not conflict with ancient rights; find low-flying aircraft a nuisance and a contradiction. {Newcomers}who blend in unobtrusively tolerated but inflated house prices resented since outsiders buy and do up old cottages while young and old of village have nowhere to live. {Change:}Social Club and new shop welcomed, provide real community service for young and elderly. Not many church-goers. Closing of school and chapel regretted. Both once essential part of village life but neither sufficiently used to be maintained. New owners of Chapel said to contribute much to villge life. Newcomers tend to be enthusiastic.
